required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoxygenation Method With a Calibrated Leak
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Preoxygenation With Spontaneous Breathing or Noninvasive Positive Pressure Ventilation With or Without a Calibrated Leak. An Experimental Study in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
During preoxygenation, imperfect seal between the face mask and patient's face can induce an inward air leak decreasing its effectiveness. We assume that noninvasive ventilation could cancel the effect of the leak.
This is a prospective study. Healthy volunteers are randomised in cross-over between spontaeous breathing or noninvasive ventilation perssure support preoxygenation in the presence or absence of a calibrated leak on the inspiratory circuit.

detailed_description.textblock:
During preoxygenation, imperfect seal between the face mask and patient's face can induce an inward air leak decreasing its effectiveness. We assume that noninvasive ventilation could cancel the effect of the leak.
We planned an experimental study with healthy volunteers (residents in anesthesiology).
Healthy volunteers are randomised in cross-over between preoxygenatio through spontaeous breathing or noninvasive ventilation perssure support preoxygenation in the presence or absence of a calibrated leak on the inspiratory circuit. The inspiratory fraction of oxygen is 100%. The exhaled gas (oxygen and carbon dioxide) are monitored.The subjects breathed through a mouthpiece (with a nose clip) connected to an anesthetic ventilator.
The primary endpoint is the time to achieve end expiratory fracion of oxygene of 90% or more.
The secondary endpoint is the proportion of subject with end expiratory fracion of oxygene of 90% or more after a 3 min period (recommended in clinical guidelines).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 groups : spontaneous breathinh and non invasive pressure support ventilation 2 conditions : without inward air leak and with inward air leak

primary_outcome.description: end expiratory fraction of oxygen measured in exhaled gas

arm_group.description: preoxygenation through spontaneous breathing of 100% oxygen gas flow
preoxygenation through non invasive pressure support ventilation of 100% oxygen gas flow

intervention.description: non invasive with +6cmH2O pressure support ventilation and +5cmH2O of positive end expiratory pressure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- any pathological condition
- active tobaco

overall_official.affiliation: CHU de Caen and universite Caen Normandie
